Examples¶

  • Basic setup

  • Advanced setup

Basic setup¶

The simplest and minimal setup you can run out of the box is described in the:

src.hippo7_app/hippo7_backend.graph_setup.simple_gan_setup

If you run the server using this for your graph generation, it will give you a graph looking like this:

Hint: You can always generate a graph visualisation like above by calling

src.hippo7_app/hippo7_backend.graph_setup.visualize_graph

Advanced setup¶

A more advanced configuration can be used with:

src.hippo7_app/hippo7_backend.graph_setup.no_gan_setup

This is actually the setup we also used at a live performance so dont feel bad, if you are overwhelmed in the beginning.

Here you have a almost endless variety of options. Some parts like the functions are a not directly understandable, this is a direct trade off for the automatic generated frontend.

Alternative input¶

There is nothing enforcing you to use BigGan as image input. You can also run the setup without any visuals, as shown in the following example:

src.hippo7_app/hippo7_backend.graph_setup.no_gan_setup

You could also always build your own graph(as described in Building your graph) with your own custom nodes as input(as seen in Creating New Nodes).
